subject: Personal Finance
title: The Decoy Effect
description: A 60-second lesson on The Decoy Effect.

hook.text: Small popcorn costs $4, large costs $8. You pick small. Add a medium at $7 and the large wins.

buildup.text: The decoy effect happens when a third option makes one original choice look like a steal.

discovery.text: Dan Ariely showed that adding a bad option steers people toward the more expensive choice.

twist.text: The decoy isn't meant to be chosen. Its only job is to make the target option look better.

climax.text: Magazine subscriptions, phone plans, and restaurant menus all use this trick daily.

punchline.text: The worst option does the most work.

quiz.question: What is the role of a decoy option?
options: To make another option look more attractive
